title: [Large-Scale] Social Constructivist-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Project for Knowledge Sharing and Organizational Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational math understanding and online learning platform proficiency
context.additional_context: Course for office/administrative professionals to enhance knowledge management and organizational learning competencies in mathematical problem-solving processes. Establishes a culture of tacit knowledge sharing through asynchronous collaboration

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to collaborate with peers and share knowledge to solve complex mathematical problems.

Within six months, learners establish three knowledge management strategies (e.g., collaboration tools, knowledge-sharing frameworks, feedback systems) based on organizational learning environment analysis in project-based assessments (team research tasks) and achieve over 80% attainment in peer and instructor evaluations.

Graduate students apply social constructivist principles (collaborative knowledge building, contextual learning) on online discussion boards, providing feedback (150+ characters) with three specific rationales (conceptual accuracy, logical consistency, real-world applicability) on peers’ mathematical ideas at least twice weekly. Over four weeks, they maintain weekly reflective journals (500–700 characters) documenting their thinking processes, with over 80% of their feedback achieving “average or above” ratings on peer evaluation rubrics.

resources: Digital collaboration tools (shared documents, video conferencing)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
